Herzog companies was founded in 1969 by William E. Herzog as a heavy/highway construction contractor in the Midwest. Herzog now specializes in Railroad Construction, Transit Operation and Maintenance Services, Civil Construction and Railroad Services nationwide. Our team consists of people who are innovators at heart, continuously exploring new ways to improve our products, services, and, ultimately, the industry. By always challenging ourselves - and each other - to push for more, we keep Herzog at the forefront of the rail industry. Herzog Contracting Corp. is seeking a  Track Laborer  in  Irving, Texas. Duties and Responsibilities:  Installs and repairs railroad track and embankments including special track work, road crossings, signage, and rail lubricators using hand and power tools and a wide variety of sizes and types of track machines including spike pullers, spike drivers, tie adze, hydraulic rail jacks, power wrenches, tie boring machines, rail drills, rail grinders, rail saws and highway trucks equipped with rail guide wheels, hydraulic booms, and lift gates to remove and replace ties, rails, fasteners (cut or screw spikes, anti-creepers, bolts, elastic clips, insulators, rail seat pads, and conventional and insulated rail joints), special track work components, crushed rock ballast, crossing surfaces, paving, subgrade material, vegetation, signs, and structures. May work as a member of a crew or independently. May work under the direction of a Railroad Track Repair Leader or Railroad Track Welder and may direct the work of Railroad Track Repairer Helpers. Qualifications:  High School diploma or GED. Three years’ experience in railroad track construction and/or maintenance with two years’ experience as a track maintenance worker using various machines for railroad construction or maintenance work in an operating railroad environment. Knowledge of safe and proper procedures for operating this equipment. Knowledge of safe and efficient manipulation of equipment and tools to perform construction and maintenance tasks. Knowledge of FTSS and FRWS and the ability to be Qualified on Authority’s examinations for 49 CFR Part 213.7 of FTSS and the GCOR related to these regulations within four weeks of Start Date. Ability to complete work under time pressures and to maintain composure under the stress of emergency situations. Must be able to work well with others. Able to read, write and communicate (speak, hear, and understand) the English language. Pre-Employment Requirements:  Subject to pre-employment background check and motor vehicle report review. Subject to pre-employment physical, medical evaluation, and drug screen due to the safety sensitive nature of this position. Successfully complete and maintain any required safety certification and testing on an annual basis. Physical Requirements:  The physical demands described below must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential job functions of this role. This position will be physically demanding at times. This is a non-exhaustive overview of the physical requirements of this job. Must be able to walk on uneven surfaces and vegetation including but not limited to rocks, inclines, beams, mud, wet, ice on a consistent basis. Must be able to be aware of surroundings and follow verbal commands while being exposed to moderately loud noises on a daily basis. Must be able to adapt to various temperature extremes including but not limited to heat, cold, moisture and wind. Must be able to operate hand controls and drive various construction equipment on the job. Able to carry various equipment and tools across uneven surfaces. Able to grasp or squeeze various equipment and tools Able to ascend/descend stairs Able to lift up to 75 lbs Able to tolerate static kneeling, bending, and squatting posture Able to sit and stand for long periods of time Able to visually distinguish colors - red, blue, green, yellow; hear and distinguish auditory signals Able to work outdoors in all weather conditions (hot, cold, rain, snow, and sleet.) Available to work a 40 hour work week subject to overtime, on call and alternate shifts that may include weeknights, weekends and holidays. Able to work in a safety sensitive work environment. Safety:  Herzog is nationally recognized for its excellent corporate safety record which results from all employees at all levels, in all positions adhering to established policies and procedures. Reporting any and all safety violations to your immediate supervisor is a prerequisite for continued employment. Safety diligence by all results in a safe work environment for all. Benefits:  Herzog offers a robust benefits package including medical and dental coverage. The plans are specific to projects and locations It is the policy of Herzog Contracting Corp. to provide equal opportunity in employment for all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, ethnicity, national origin, ancestry, disability, medical condition, age, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, military status, veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by law. Job Type: Full-time

94D Air Traffic Control Equipment Repairer 
 
 Job ID : 1246366 
 Job Views : 541 
 Location:  CAMP ROBINSON, Arkansas, United States 
 ZIP Code:  72199 
 Job Category:  Mechanic and Maintenance 
 Posted:  04.16.2020 
 Age Requirements:  Must be between the ages of 17 and 35 
 
 Job Description 
 For air traffic controllers to manage the skies, their equipment must function properly; and that’s where you come in. As an Air Traffic Control Equipment Repairer, you help ensure flight safety by performing field and sustainment-level maintenance and installation of all air traffic control equipment for the Army National Guard. 
 
As a member of the electronic maintenance team, the Air Traffic Control Equipment Repairer is responsible for the maintenance and installation of air traffic control communications, navigation aids, and landing systems. In short, planes can’t take off or land without you. 
 
 Job Duties 
 Test instruments, navigational controls, and simulators using electronic and electrical test equipment Replace equipment parts, such as resistors, switches, and circuit boards Perform quality control measures Install and adjust air traffic control communications and navigation aids systems 
 
Some of the Skills You’ll Learn 
 Electronic principles and concepts 
Through your training, you will develop the skills and experience to enjoy a civilian career with small and large airstrips or airports, manufacturing companies, medical research facilities, satellite communications firms, or airline companies. 
 
 Earn While You Learn 
Instead of paying to learn these skills, get paid to train. In the Army National Guard, you will learn these valuable job skills while earning a regular paycheck and qualifying for tuition assistance.
 
 
Job training for Air Traffic Control Equipment Repairer consists of 10 weeks of Basic Training, where you'll learn basic Soldiering skills, and 38 weeks of Advanced Individual Training and on-the-job instruction, including practice in repairing and replacing equipment parts. Training consists of both classroom and field work. 
 
 Benefits/Requirements 
 Benefits 
 
 Paid training 
 A monthly paycheck 
 Montgomery GI Bill 
 Federal and State tuition assistance 
 Retirement benefits for part-time service 
 Low-cost life insurance (up to $400,000 in coverage) 
 401(k)-type savings plan 
 Student Loan Repayment Program (up to $50,000, for existing loans) 
 Health care benefits available
 VA home loans 
 Bonuses, if applicable
 Most non-prior service candidates will earn between $200 and $250 per drill weekend, subject to change 
 
 
 Requirements 
 Military enlistment in the Army National Guard 
 Must be at least a junior in high school, or have a high school diploma or a GED certificate 
 Must be between the ages of 17 and 35 
 Must be able to pass a physical exam and meet legal and moral standards 
 Must meet citizenship requirements (see NATIONALGUARD.com for details) 
 
 
Requires military enlistment. Programs and benefits are subject to change. Ask your Army National Guard recruiter for the most up-to-date information. Actual MOS assignment may depend on MOS availability. 
 
This position may qualify for a bonus, ask your National Guard recruiter for the most up-to-date information.

We are seeking hard working, motivated, and energetic individuals to work for a wood pallet logistics site. The positions available under Skilled Warehouse Production Worker are Machine Pallet Sort, Industrial Painter, Bandsaw Operator, Quality Auditor, and Wood Pallet Repairer. These positions require constant standing, bending, stooping, walking and the ability to lift and handle material with weight up to 75 pounds or more frequently throughout the day. These positions do require the ability to do repetitive work, as well as comprehensive knowledge of general construction type repair methods, the proper utilization and care of power tools, materials, and industrial machinery. 
 
Work Schedule: 
 
 1st Shift:  6:00 am to 2:30 pm  (Monday thru Friday) 
 2nd Shift:  3:30 pm to 12:00 am  (Monday thru Friday) 
 
 Benefits: 
 
 Medical 
 Dental 
 Vision 
 Short term disability insurance 
 Lift Insurance 
 Other complimentary insurance 
 All health benefits are effective on the first of the month following 60 days of the date of hire. 
 
 Other Benefits: 
 
 PayActiv  - Access 50% of your earned wages prior to your pay date. 
 Kazoo Program  - Incentive program (get points for doing a great job and redeem Cash (direct deposit on check), gift cards, Company Swag, & more) 
 PTO  (Pay Time Off) starts accruing on 1st day of employment.
 Wellness Visits are covered at 100% 
 Scholarship fund 
 Service awards 
 
 ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS 
 
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable Accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 
 
 If assigned to machine operator, you are responsible for the safe operation and maintenance of assigned machinery while following all outlined policies and procedures related to such equipment. 
 If assigned to bandsaw operation, you are responsible for the teardown of wood pallets using the bandsaw machine, while following all outlined policies and procedure related to such equipment. 
 If assigned to pallet repair, you are responsible for the repair of customer's pallets, ensuring production and quality standards are met. This requires the ability to dismantle wood pallets through the use of a hand saw, while using other power tools like nail guns for repair. 
 If assigned to the painter position, you are responsible for painting pallets as a part of the overall quality repair of pallets. 
 Responsible for maintaining a clean work environment-sweeping debris around warehouse and dock areas. 
 Ensure compliance and follow all safety and Propak policies and procedures. 
 Responsible for all other duties as assigned to support and improve the overall team operations. 
 Reporting relationships, work assignments, and work schedules are subject to change to meet the company needs and business requirements. 
 Teamwork and cooperation are required for proper job performance. 
 The ability to meet fast-paced productivity goals and standards. 
 The ability to work in a physically demanding warehouse environment 
 Must have the ability to show up to work on your scheduled days. Attendance at work is an essential function of this job. Our customers' needs Propak employees to be reliable and meet our weekly goals and numbers. 
 Must be open to learning new skills. If you do not have prior experience, we are willing to train the right candidate. 
 
  Competency Statement(s) 
 
 Accountability - Ability to accept responsibility and account for his/her actions. 
 Communication, Oral - Ability to communicate effectively with others using the spoken word. 
 Reliability - The trait of being dependable and trustworthy. 
 Responsible - Ability to be held accountable or answerable for one's conduct. 
 Safety Awareness - Ability to identify and correct conditions that affect employee safety. 
 SKILLS & ABILITIES 
 
 Education:  High School Graduate or General Education Degree (GED): Preferred 
 Experience:  No prior experience necessary but prior experience in a warehouse or construction environment preferred 
 Computer Skills:  not required but preferred 
 
 Propak Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request, by contacting hiring@propak.com. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

This is an exceptional opportunity to leverage your current engineering consulting experience and tap into this ever-expanding NYC market. 
 
 GeoStructures, Inc . is searching for a  Business Development Engineer  to develop relationships with our clients and assist them in identifying the optimal solutions for their geotechnical challenges. The successful candidate works from their home office in NJ or greater NYC metropolitan area. 
 
 The right candidate will have the following experience: 
 Civil Engineer degree required; MS degree in Civil Engineering or Geotechnical Engineering a plus 
 5+ years of experience (combination of geotechnical engineering, proposal/bid/business development responsibilities, or consulting) 
 Don’t let this opportunity pass you by! Apply now!
 
 
 Essential Job Duties: 
 Regularly meet with customers in NYC metropolitan area to maintain and establish client relationships and new work. 
 Provide value to client through presentation of cost-effective geotechnical solutions. 
 Provide pre-construction technical assistance and education to clients as required. 
 Prepare proposals and work with estimators and preliminary engineering to provide project bids for opportunities in an efficient and timely manner. 
 Understand customer goals and technical challenges
 Search for new clients who might benefit from our services and maximize client potential in designated regions. 
 Negotiate contract terms and conditions to meet both client and company needs. 
 Prepare pre-bid forecast and other reports to monitor work in progress. 
 
 
 This will be an excellent position for someone who: 
 Is a motivated self-starter, presents comfortably with engineers, senior level executives or project superintendents in the field 
 Listens to customer needs and translates into solutions in a thoughtful and compelling fashion 
 Creates and fosters win-win customer relationships 
 Is a proactive team player who craves winning in pursuit of financial rewards 
 Has demonstrated success in consultative selling and providing innovative solutions 
 Enjoys prospecting and opening new doors 
 
If you are an individual with disabilities and need assistance with this site, please contact Human Resources at (540)751-5034. 
 
We comply with the ADA and consider reasonable accommodation measures that may be necessary for eligible applicants/employees to perform essential functions.

Do you want to help businesses and organizations reduce waste and gain new efficiencies and insights with the latest Internet of Things technologies? We do, and we’re looking for a talented Field Application Engineer to join us in driving sales. 
 At Temboo, we build software tools and applications that people are using to fundamentally change the world around us. Temboo is empowering people to build an amazingly diverse range of physical computing systems at the intersection of hardware, software and human aspiration, and we want you to help us as we grow and scale Temboo. A few highlights: 
 Temboo software comes pre-shipped in hardware development platforms for millions of devices from companies like Texas Instruments, Samsung, Arduino, and more to come. 
 Our customers have implemented a wide range of IoT applications across different industries, from wearables-based medical research and aviation component maintenance, to industrial baked goods manufacturing, and even octopus farming! 
 Temboo integrates with over 100 internal and external APIs and cloud services, and we work closely with API providers such as Amazon and Microsoft to make their APIs more accessible. 
 Engineers, plant managers, and others who manage physical assets like facilities, equipment, and labs have upskilled themselves with Temboo, using our tools to build their own Internet-connected sensor and hardware applications for their jobs and in the process learning IoT development skills without going through formal training or education. 
 Temboo has been adopted as a teaching tool by over 150 universities worldwide, in courses ranging from traditional CS and engineering to digital art and urban data mining, and is a New York State approved provider of IoT instruction for professional licensed engineers. 
 As a member of the Product Outreach team, you’ll be a key link between engineering and sales, helping customers implement Temboo and driving revenue growth. 
 Our team is smart, committed, and fun. We’re dedicated to defining innovative, elegant solutions to brand new challenges. Help us re-imagine programming for everyone, from mechanical engineers and research scientists, to city designers and farmers. 
 What You'll Be Doing 
 Helping customers and prospects understand and implement Temboo; providing guidance on component selection and application design; troubleshooting technical issues 
 Qualifying, consulting for, and designing technical sales presentations; building and presenting relevant, customized demos 
 Strategizing and managing inbound and outbound sales processes; growing revenue from businesses of all sizes 
 Maintaining high levels of customer engagement and satisfaction 
 Empathizing with all aspects of the customer experience and thinking through each stage of the customer lifecycle 
 Helping develop onboarding resources, sales assets, and other relevant content 
 What We're Looking For In You 
 Relevant work experience in a sales or sales engineering role, preferably at a hardware, semiconductor, or systems integrator company 
 A technical background via education and/or experience with knowledge of at least one of the following: electrical engineering, computer science, data science, or mechanical engineering 
 Self-motivated team player with innovative ideas who can test and implement them skillfully 
 Strong interpersonal skills and experience building strong relationships 
 Diplomacy, tact, and grace under pressure when working through customer issues 
 Startup experience is a plus 
 2019-08-01
 104 Franklin St. New York, NY 10013
 Full-time

When you are part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. 
Your work will have real-world impact, and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals. 
Position Summary: 
We are searching for a talented Service Engineer to troubleshoot, repair, install, and update Finesse products, along with consulting with customers at their sites. 
Responsibilities: 
Troubleshoot, repair, install, and update Finesse (now part of Thermo Fisher Scientific) products at client sites as needed. 
Consult with customers regarding product operation, product optimization, technical troubleshooting and usage training. 
Aid in optimizing revenue and new product development opportunities while maintaining a high level of responsiveness and customer satisfaction. 
Help to cultivate customer satisfaction through ensuring prompt customer response times and problem resolution. 
Provides up-to-date service reporting on customer activities. 
Perform Site Acceptance Test (SAT) and Installation/Operational Qualification (IQ/OQ) Protocols. 
Provide regular updates to management on customer requests for new products and on competitive activity; provide customer feedback to hardware and software groups. 
Maintain a high level of integrity with existing and potential client base. 
Maximize the service potential for revenue and customer satisfaction. 
Develop and implement technical assistance and product training to Sales group. 
Obtain customer software backups as necessary. 
Interface technically and assist in demonstration of Finesse products to potential customers. 
Unpack equipment, stage equipment in customer’s lab: Computers, Vessel stations (G3Lab Universals, G3Pro, etc.), TruLogic, Scales (if applicable), TCU (if applicable). 
Connect all process and network cables as well as utilities (electrical, chilled water, etc.). 
Verify communication between computers, TruLogic, vessel stations and additional equipment. 
Minimum Qualifications: 
Bachelor's degree in Engineering or equivalent work experience 
Electrical/software or mechanical engineering or scientific background. 
Competent with Microsoft applications such as Word, Excel and Outlook. 
Preferred Qualifications: 
Certified Bio-Med, Electrical, Mechanical or Controls Engineer. 
Delta V or other control software experience. 
Experienced with Single Use Technology (Upstream and/or downstream). 
Commissioning and Qualifications (C&Q) experience in facility, equipment or utilities. 
Knowledge of Corrective Action and Preventive Action (CAPA), change control, deviations management and document management systems. 
At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 70,000 extraordinary minds have a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission—enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. 
Thermo Fisher is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

General Description: 
 The Solution Engineer (SE) position at INAP owns all aspects of the technical sales process, and is the ultimate expert in all of INAP’s datacenter services including Hosting, Colocation, CDN and IP Services. The SE is expected to have a strong background in the managed hosting and cloud services environment to be able to define customer requirements and translate those requirements into INAP technical solutions. They play a role in both designing highly complex solutions as well as influencing the product roadmap of the company. The SE takes pride at being at the forefront of Internet technologies, and is a technical tinkerer by nature. 
 Who You Are 
 You may have had a past life in IT Operations and realized you being on-call 24x7x365 was insane and moved to sales engineer role. You might still be in IT Ops as a systems architect and now realized that you need more of a challenge. You probably have a (or had) a server rack in your garage or basement at one time for fun. You’re an extrovert! You love to tinker with technology for fun and are working on a few different projects. You are equally comfortable in a dress suit and tie but can rock in jeans, t-shirt and a sport coat. 
 Solution Engineering 
 The primary responsibility of the Solution Engineer to act in a technical advisory /consultative role is for customers, and account executives. Working with other solution engineers he or she will architect complex IT solutions for our customers. The SE requires a broad range of understanding and experience at the application layer to optimize performance over flexible and high performing infrastructure. The SE should be able to articulate in communicating that value to both technical and non-technical audiences. 
 Leadership and Mentoring 
The SE is expected to provide leadership to account representatives as well as other internal organizations (business units, cloud and hosting engineering, hosting and network operations and data center field operations engineers). The Solution Engineers are the thought leaders of the technical services organization. 
 Geography and Travel 
 This position supports sales branches that are located in their particular region. They may also be required to travel to other markets or other locations where customer IT engineering group may be located to conduct and lead on site meetings, and drive the overall technical solution that we present to customers. 
 SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES: 
 IaaS Consultant 
 In this role, the SE will work with the customer identify technical requirements, inform and improve where possible, and develop solution designs which meet these requirements. 
  The SE is expected to know existing as well as emerging IT technologies, including Hybrid hosting, Disaster Recovery solutions and traditional VMware, Microsoft Server sizing. 
  The SE must maintain their technical understanding across INAP’s entire infrastructure stack, including Colocation, CDN, IP, Dedicated Servers, Cloud Hosting and Storage. 
  Internally, the SE is the customer interface for INAP’s R&D and Product Management and has responsible for the technical training and development of the sales representatives across all channels. 
 Sales Engineering Support 
 In pre-sales scenarios, the SE provides sales support and is instrumental in all aspects of sales cycle. 
  The SE will work closely with the Account Executives to position our technology and its differentiators against the competition 
  The SE must be able to glean business problems and subsequently design and present technical solutions for these problems. 
  The SE role requires a high level of sales acumen and is intrinsic in developing and delivering strategies to close key opportunities. 
  The SE must possess a detailed knowledge across the spectrum of hosting and Infrastructure as a Service technologies offered by INAP and be able to articulate features, functionality and uses cases to both technical and non-technical audience. 
  Participate in the customer business planning activities and provide guidance architectural solutions 
  The SE is the technical evangelist for prospective customers as well as INAP as a whole. 
 QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE: 
 The ideal candidate must be motivated and possess an excellent track record in the sale of IT technological solutions, and be comfortable in the dynamic atmosphere of a technical organization providing services to a rapidly expanding clientele. 
 1. Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field preferred. 
 2. Relevant experience (2-5+ years) with Hosting and/or Cloud companies, either operations or technical sales position is preferred. Detailed knowledge of hosting technologies including VMware, Xen, OpenStack and CloudStack preferred as well as Dedicated Servers, Managed Hosting and Colocation required. 
 3. Detailed knowledge and sizing experience of networking technologies including firewalls (Cisco ASA series), load balancers (F5), and switching environments including 10G architecture. 
 4. Detailed experience with storage architectures, both traditional SAN (NetApp & Equilogic) as well as Object Based Storage systems like OpenStack Swift are highly desired. 
 5. Familiarity with the Hosting Industries’ key players, and their technology is a plus. 
 6. Computing experience in both Microsoft and Linux environments 
 7. Prior sales experience either in technology or related fields. 
 8. Confident, articulate and comfortable driving a conversation or presentation 
 9. Self-reliant and takes initiative to get the things that need doing done.

BUSINESS SUMMARY: 
At VMware we currently have an excellent opportunity within our Solutions Engineering organization for an experienced Pre-Sales Solutions Engineer (SE) to join our team in Southeastern New York State. 
Are you looking to become a member of a talented team and help shape the future of business in a digital world? If so, we would love to hear from you! As a VMware Solutions Engineer (SE) you will play a substantial role in building and sustaining customer relationships while driving the adoption of VMware solutions and exceeding our revenue goals. As an SE you will work closely with sales and extended teams to build business relationships and align with customers’ outcomes. As an SE your role will be impactful, visible, and rewarding. 
Location:  This is a home office-based position (preferred locations: Southeast NY, Long Island, Northern NJ) and will require frequent travel to customer locations in New York State. 
Travel:  50-70% This job requisition is not eligible for employment-based immigration sponsored by VMware 
JOB ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 
As a VMware SE, you will work closely with the field sales team to collaborate on customer solutions. 
Understand the customer's business objectives, and match VMware, and Other Partner solutions to achieve customer's business and technical requirements. 
Build long-term business relationships and become a trusted adviser for customers across all lines of business. 
Continuously develop and expand the knowledge of customers' business and mission. 
Create and present solutions that address customers' needs using the VMware portfolio along with third-party solutions. 
Create and present demos that are aligned to customer needs 
Manage the planning and execution of customer Proof of Concepts as required 
Present VMware value proposition, vision and technologies, strategy, and product roadmaps to partners and customer roles including executives, technical management, and technical engineers. 
Pro-actively maintain expertise of VMware technologies via personal enablement and internal training offerings 
Maintain technical and business knowledge of cloud computing applications, industry direction, and trends 
Maintain working knowledge of competitive offerings and architectures 
Work with customers to obtain technical validation of proposed solution and build high-level architecture drawings. 
Assist with financial and infrastructure data collection and creation of customer ROI/TCO reports. 
Assist with preparation of proposals, statements of work, and supporting documents for customers. 
Identify new customer projects for VMware solutions, and participate in demand generating events and activities. 
Provide consistent field reporting, and data input via Salesforce.com 
REQUIRED SKILLS: 
5 or more years of experience in information technology (IT). 
Pre-sales or customer facing experience with strong relationship building skills. 
Experience in positioning/selling Professional Services as part of Solution Selling. 
Strong technical comprehension of VMware technologies and the ability to stay current in the latest VMware and partner technologies. 
Ability to effectively present to audiences and adjust to level of role and understanding. 
Ability to uncover business challenges and objectives and develop a documented custom solution to tackle those challenges. 
A balanced infrastructure and software engineering background. 
Ability to develop and effectively communicate business cases and justifications to partners. 
BA/BS in related field 
 
PREFERRED SKILLS: 
We look for individuals who embody our values of humility, compassion, collaboration above isolationism, respectfulness, honesty, and good-nature fun. Additionally, we would like: 
VCP or equivalent VMware hands-on experience highly preferred. 
Experience in State, Local Government and Education (SLED) market preferred. 
Experience with IT consolidation and technology integration projects which include VMware technology and 3rd party API integration or in a cloud native setting. 
Experience with public cloud or hybrid cloud architectures and services is highly desirable. 
 
Category :  Sales 
 Subcategory:  Systems Engineering 
 Experience:  Manager and Professional 
 Full Time/ Part Time:  Full Time 
 Posted Date:  2020-03-07

Ferric is a fabless semiconductor startup company based in New York City that is pioneering an entirely new approach to power delivery for Integrated Circuits and Electronic Assemblies. This approach leverages Ferric’s integration of thin-film magnetic inductors with CMOS technology to enable a significant improvement in the integration density and efficiency of voltage regulators (VRs) compared with current commercially available technologies. 
As a Ferric Applications Engineer, you will be the primary technical resource for sales and marketing teams. You will be responsible for actively driving and managing technology evaluation and adoption stages of sales and business development processes. Applications engineers must be able to identify and provide reliable solutions for all technical issues to assure complete customer satisfaction through all stages of product development process. You must be able to establish and maintain strong relationships with customers and all stake holders during the sales and support cycle. As part of working at Ferric, you will gain exposure to the full product-life of Ferric’s ICs by working with a diverse cross-functional team including IC designers, test engineers, engineering vendors, the fab, and our customers. The position requires a strong background in mixed-signal IC design and test, experience with standard circuit test lab equipment, object oriented programming, and data-analysis skills. Applicants should be self-motivating and possess excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, as well as excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to work well and contribute on a team. 
Primary Responsibilities: Maintain expert level of product knowledge and applications Articulate technology and product positioning to both business and technical users Provide design and specification development support to customer, ODMs, CMs, integrators and distributors Listen, understand and convey customer requirements Provide/perform technical training for sales, customers and engineers at target account Design/develop demonstration platform for Ferric products with optimized performance for customer applications Assist in design and development of new products by bringing customers’ experiences and feedback in design cycle Travel to customer and project sites to help start up, demo and address issues Bench-level characterization, and data collection in support of customer and sales requirements of full ICs and IC sub-systems Development of technical graphs, charts, specifications to meet customers’ need and general product collaterals Development and execution of Python scripts to automate the characterization and data acquisition of key DC-DC power-converter metrics Circuit and PCB design (and occasional assembly) of bench-level IC test boards Interface with customers to review IC test measurement data and procedures 
Desired Skills and Experience: Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in EE Industry Experience: 0-5 years Self-motivated, possessing a willingness to learn and grow with the position, and able to take on full ownership of finding engineering solutions Excellent communication skills and effectively be able to share information with others, including Ferric customers Strong problem-solving skills, with solid understanding of mixed-signal IC design and test Programming Languages: Python, Verilog Familiarity with VISA API and SCPI standard for communicating with test equipment Familiarity with equipment communication protocols, including USB, RS232, GPIB, etc. Lab experience with the following equipment: Oscilloscope, Digital Multimeter (DMM), Source Measure Unit (SMU), DC Power Supply Unit (PSU), Electronic Load, Spectrum Analyzer, Opal Kelly, etc. Knowledge of DC-DC power-converters/regulators (Buck, Boost, LDO, etc.) Software: Cadence Virtuoso Suite, Cadence Allegro, Xilinx ISE, and Linux & Windows operating systems Experience with PCB design and assembly, including component selection, soldering, etc. Proficient in MS Office Available to travel 25% 
Preferred/Plus Skills and Experience: Education: Master’s Degree in EE Industry Experience: 2-5 years of IC test experience Customer and sales support experience Strong Knowledge of power management requirements of High Performance Computing, and mobile platforms Knowledge of automation tools Proven project management skills 
Other Requirements:  Ferric is unable to provide sponsorship for employment visa status for this position. 
Location: New York, NY 
To apply please email your resume to careers@ferricsemi.com

Job Summary The G.A.L. Group is looking to fill the position of Application Engineer, who under the direction of the Controls Manager will primarily be responsible for verifying data required for industrial control equipment, align specifications, standards and changes with specific customer needs, and work with multiple departments and product lines to meet the customer’s requirements. After the product has been delivered to the customer, the Application Engineer will have to assist customers in solving technical issues. The Application Engineer should have a degree in Electrical Technology, Electrical Engineering, or a related field and have 1-3 years of related experience. Job Duties Manage and interpret customer requirements and specifications. Customize the company’s Industrial Control equipment to meet customer’s needs and specifications. Process change orders that may require the modification of company products and equipment. Work with various departments such as Customer Service, Estimating, Sales, and Manufacturing to ensure client specifications are met. Problem solve and provide assistance to all company departments and answer questions about the technical functionality of the industrial control equipment. Provide assistance to technical support for industrial control products. Orchestrate both simple and complex tasks with limited supervision. Daily responsibilities will depend on his or her ability to produce results from existing limited solutions and to maintain a professional attitude. Participate in information gathering calls and/or meetings with clients to determine the clients' needs, and desired outcomes. These meetings may involve job site visits, and surveying that may lead to job specific product development. Present information and new ideas for review and possible implementation into new and existing products. Work Conditions Working in a busy office environment with frequent interruptions Risk of injury on manufacturing floor Occasional overtime Occasional travel Competencies Problem Solving - Able to break down a situation into smaller pieces to identify key issues and figure out cause and effect relationships and use logic and analytical methods to come to realistic solution. Client/Customer Focus - Provides superior service to both internal and external customers. Attention to Detail - Attends to details and pursues quality in the accomplishment of tasks, regardless of the volume of duties encountered. Time Management - Balances a myriad of tasks; prioritizes duties as needed. Ownership - Takes pride in the work that is accomplished and understands the function of tasks within the larger picture of the organization. Ensures deadlines are met and work is completed properly. Results Orientation - Able to focus on desired outcomes, and how they are achieved by meeting and or exceeding standards based on past performance, goals, and objectives, as well as the performance and/or achievements of others. Continuous Improvement - Strives to improve job responsibilities through developing skills and increasing knowledge. Job Requirements Degree in Electrical Technology, Electrical Engineering, or a related field 1-3 years of related experience Autodesk AutoCAD knowledge required 3-D AutoCAD drawing experience preferred Data analysis, math, and problem solving skills highly preferred Excellent communication and time management skills Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment Willingness to learn Excellent interpersonal skills Job Type: Full-time Experience: Electrical Engineering: 1 year (Preferred) Education: Bachelor's (Required) Location: Bronx, NY 10451 (Required) Work authorization: United States (Required) Application Question: What are your salary requirements? Additional Compensation: Bonuses Work Location: One location Benefits: Health insurance Dental insurance Vision insurance Retirement plan Paid time off Tuition reimbursement Schedule: Monday to Friday No weekends Benefit Conditions: Only full-time employees eligible

Transmit Security is hiring a Professional Services Engineer Superstar to join our rapidly expanding Team. We are seeking an experienced Professional Services Engineer who is responsible for presenting product offerings and architecture in the best light to prospects and customers, to evoke confidence in company's technology infrastructure, and to remove all technical objections in the sales cycle. To accomplish this, the Professional Services Engineer must have a strong desire to leverage their Technical and Sales Skills, including the ability to solicit business requirements, develop technical sales strategies, configure and effectively demonstrate the solutions that address these requirements and provide business value.
 
Professional Services Engineer will be responsible for the following:
 
The well-being of the Customer
 
 Monitoring & overseeing customers' technical needs (including:  Request for Enhancements, Request for Services, and Support Tickets)
 
Manage all technical product-related queries and liaise between Resident Engineers, Professional Services, Client Services, and Development Team
 
Understand Customer Projects, future strategies and tech road-maps
 
Provide technical, product and business knowledge to strengthen customer relationship
 
Priorities and manage Professional Services personnel tasks
 
Point of contact for customer escalation
 
The Professional Services Engineer role is a combination of an Architect and a Project Manager. The goal is to be accountable for the Customer's success within the account (meaning that they will need to help the customer to maximize the value of the solution). The Professional Services Engineer will be responsible for managing the local Resident Engineer and will have access to the Professional Services Architect (including Professional Services Developers) & Client Services resources and should prioritize the customer needs.
 
Qualifications
 
Bachelor Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related program
 
5+ years of mobile and development experience
 
5+ years of IAM, network and security experience
 
Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
 
Communicate effectively with both internal staff and external clients
 
Ability to work independently as well as part of a team
 
Strong overall background in Enterprise architecture and design
 
Strong overall mobile development skills. This includes native objective-c, Swift (iOS) and Java (Android) programming languages
 
Strong background in development platforms such as Cordova, Ionic3, Phonegap, MobileFirst/Worklight
 
Expertise with integrating third party mobile SDKs into both iOS and Android mobile applications
 
Strong understanding of best practices and security applied to mobile application development
 
Expertise with all aspects of transport as applied to mobile applications (connection handling, push notifications, client-side certificates/SSL, PKI on mobile)
 
Expertise with Unix and native mobile operating systems
 Solid understanding of Web applications, Web APIs (REST/JSON), web protocols, (i.e. http/s, JavaScript, SSL, DNS, proxies/caches, firewalls, etc..)
 
Support sales team on prospect conference calls, virtual meetings and onsite visits by providing product demonstrations expertly responding to technical questions and explaining features in the context of solving customer's business problems.
 
Excellent time management, multi-tasking, prioritization skills and ability to manage multiple concurrent projects.
 
Transmit Security is committed to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of Diversity and Inclusion. Our human capital is the most valuable asset we have. The collective sum of the individual differences, life experiences, knowledge, inventiveness, innovation, self-expression, unique capabilities and talent that our employees invest in their work represents a significant part of not only our Culture, but our Reputation and Achievements as well. We embrace and encourage our employees' differences in age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socioeconomic status, veteran status, and other any other characteristics that make our employees unique.

The Schaeffler Group is a global automotive and industrial supplier. Top quality, outstanding technology, and exceptionally innovative spirit form the basis for the continued success of the company. By delivering high-precision components and systems in engine, transmission, and chassis applications, as well as rolling and plain bearing solutions for a large number of industrial applications, the Schaeffler Group is already shaping “Mobility for tomorrow” to a significant degree. The technology company generated sales of approximately EUR 13.3 billion in 2016. With around 89,400 employees, Schaeffler is one of the world’s largest family companies and, with approximately 170 locations in over 50 countries, has a worldwide network of manufacturing locations, research and development facilities, and sales companies. 
 
Schaeffler FAG Aerospace Canada Inc.  a world class designer, developer and manufacturer of aerospace bearings, is seeking an  Account Executive Engineer  in  Stratford, ON  for the Aerospace Division. The plant serves the North American aerospace market primarily supplying bearings for aircraft engines, engine systems and helicopter drive train applications. 
 
 
Key responsibilities include but not limited to: 
 
 
 APPLICATION ENGINEERING: 
 Review engineered product definition for produceability, design improvement, lean manufacturing or cost reductions. 
 Make proposals to customers based on engineering knowledge. 
 Review and administer new contracts. 
 Lead functional teams for new product introduction. Manage NPI schedules. Provide preliminary design calculations. 
 Review and approve drawings. 
 Review customer specifications. Negotiate with the customer for changes. Maintain internal specifications to the customer specifications. 
 Provide the customer with engineered design modifications that improve part function manufacturability and/or throughput and/or cost. 
 Make engineering decisions as to the usability of deviating parts. 
 Participate in lean walks to aid the shop in changing design and process to improve yield and manufacturability. 
 Build customer confidence, through the creation of engineering reports which are compliant with the customer’s needs, to qualify new sources and new pieces of equipment. 
 Prepare the analysis in the event of a failed bearing to determine root cause and report to customer. 
 Interface with other Aerospace manufacturing divisions on joining projects, technology development.

  ACCOUNT MANAGEMENT: 
 Keep customers informed of the latest engineering technology Schaeffler has to support them. 
 Identify and initiate new project introductions. 
 Obtain prototype, production tooling and production orders. 
 Maintain forecast data and support quote and engineering proposals 
 Coordinate the resolution of production startup and run at rate issues. 
 Coordinate resolution of quality, delivery, inventory and receivable issues. 
 Put the best/appropriate Schaeffler resource in front of the customer. 
 Demonstrate in-depth knowledge of market and customers to develop and execute successful business plan, including sales goals and strategies. 
 Maintain current business in addition to achieving sales growth targets and continuously improving/deepening customer relations. 
 Translate customer needs into Schaeffler technology 
 Effectively manage/motivate cross-functional project teams to meet Schaeffler and customer expectations re: deliverables and timing 
 
 
Qualified candidates will have: 
 
 BSc in Engineering. Mechanical, Systems, Aerospace or Materials Engineering 
 Membership or eligible for Professional Engineers Ontario 
 Experience in a manufacturing environment. Precision machining preferred 
 Project Management experience 
 Basic business and Accounting knowledge

 Must be assertive, outgoing, and personable

 Proficiency with MS applications

Simio is seeking a channel manager to execute the Simio go to market strategy through current and potential international channel partners. These partners sell Simio software and services to our global clients. The focus of this role is to build successful relationships with Simio channel partners in order to develop and support sales strategies and to train and develop their sales team. This role will report into the Vice President of Strategic Alliances. As an International Channel Manager, you will be responsible for many of the following:
 Educate Simio partners on Simio’s strategy and ensure Partner’s business model aligns to support Simio’s vision and the strategy of Simio’s partner program
 Enable and support channel partners’ pre-sales teams to present our unique process digital twin suite of products 
 Support channel partners to be successful at regional or local events, such as trade shows, conferences or other events 
 Monitor the health of each partner by measuring key performance indicators set by Simio leadership 
 Manage and track partners’ sales & marketing execution, making sure that the Simio brand is properly reflected across all channels
 Identify opportunities to improve effectiveness and efficiencies with processes, sales methodology, tools, product offerings, and partner development.
 Contribute to build best practices and Simio IP to share learning across the organization and amongst Simio partners 
 Requirements for this position: 
 Bachelor’s degree. A degree in Industrial Engineering, Business or related technical field is a plus. 
 2+ years of experience in channel management, channel development and software sales
 Proven ability of building and maintaining productive relationships with partners or customers, that involved motivating, coaching and leading
 Ability to effectively communicate with all levels within the organization and maintain a customer service focused mindset
 Aptitude and willingness to quickly learn the technical details of the Simio software in order to recommend the appropriate Simio solution that will address the customer business requirements
 Strategic thinker with who is able to blend technology and business strategy to develop/present compelling plans for new partner initiatives
 An entrepreneurial mindset, high energy, enthusiasm, and strong work ethic
 Thrive in fast-paced, collaborative and ever-changing environments
 Candidate must be willing to travel up to 60% of the time (includes international travel)
 Additional desirable experience: 
 In addition to English, additional language skills are desirable, especially German 
 Experience in manufacturing IT applications, decision support, optimization, supply chain and advanced planning and scheduling (SAP PP/DS, Kinaxis, Preactor, i2, PlanetTogether, Ortems, etc.)
 Experience with discrete event simulation software (Arena, AnyLogic, Simio, etc.) 
 Salesforce experience is a plus
